content.text: On the diagram, draw all the lines of symmetry.
Shade one square so that the diagram has rotational symmetry of order 2.
Find the value of the reciprocal of 0.25 .
Work out \(-6 \times -3 + 7 \times 2\).
Write these numbers in order, starting with the smallest.
A film starts at 19 35.
The film lasts for 70 minutes.
Work out the time the film finishes.
10 A shape is drawn on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
(a) Find the area of the shape.
On the grid, shade \(50 \%\) of the shape.
cm<sup>2</sup> [1]
Kat has a method for finding the difference between two square numbers, \(a^{2}-b^{2}\). Her method is
(the sum of \(a\) and \(b\)) \(\times\) (the difference between \(a\) and \(b\)) .
She shows her method for \(17^{2}-13^{2}\).
Work out \(29^{2}-21^{2}\) using Kat's method.
In this part, all lengths are in centimetres.
cm<sup>3</sup>
Complete this statement.
Show that the length of \(B C\) is 5 cm.
Complete the net of the prism on the \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
The base has been drawn for you.
The diagram shows a prism.
Work out the volume of the prism.
NOT TO SCALE
13 Convert 8 litres into \(\mathrm{cm}^3\).
The diagram shows a triangular prism.
\(A B C\) is an isosceles triangle with \(A C=B C\).
The perpendicular height of triangle \(A B C\) is 4 cm.
\(A B=6 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(B D=6 \mathrm{~cm}\).
(a) Write down the mathematical name for triangle \(B C D\).
Work out the value of \(y\).
Give two geometrical reasons for your answer.
The diagram shows a triangle \(B C D\) and a straight line \(A B C\). \(D B{=}D C{=}B C\).
What type of correlation is shown in the scatter diagram?
17 Line \(L\) is shown on the grid.
Find the equation of line \(L\) in the form \(y=m x+c\).
Line \(L\) crosses the \(x\)-axis at \(P\).
Find the coordinates of \(P\).
Describe the relationship between the temperature and the number of people on the beach.
Jill records the temperature and the number of people on a beach for each of ten days. The results are shown in the scatter diagram.
Complete the table of values for \(y=\frac{12}{x}\).
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=\frac{12}{x}\) for \(-6 \leqslant x \leqslant-1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\).
On the grid, draw the line \(y=-9\).
Use your graph to solve \(\frac{12}{x}=-9\).
Write down the values of \(n\) that satisfy \(7<n \leqslant 15\).
\(n\) is an odd number.
Pip thinks \(-1<x<8\) is the inequality represented on the number line.
Complete the statement.
The height, \(h\) metres, of a building is 635 m, correct to the nearest metre.
Complete this statement about the value of \(h\).
MARK>[2]
Find the value of \(X\) when \(w=5\) and \(p=6\).
Make \(p\) the subject of the formula.
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form.
23 Mai buys two batteries. The probability that a battery is faulty is \(\frac{1}{10}\).
Find the probability that Mai buys two faulty batteries.
A shop sells 3000 batteries in one month.
Work out the expected number of faulty batteries the shop sells.
Work out \(1 \frac{7}{15}-\frac{4}{5}\).
A circle has radius 7 cm.
A square has side \(x \mathrm{~cm}\).
The circumference of the circle is the same length as the perimeter of the square.
Find the value of \(x\).
Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\).
Triangle \(A B C\) is mathematically similar to triangle \(P Q R\).
Show that \(Q R=14 \mathrm{~cm}\).
BLANK PAGE
BLANK PAGE
